note: Childbearing years is defined by the authors as the average of 15–49 years, while working age is defined as the average of 15–65 years old.
title: Comparison of fertility rates that account for survival of children
subtitle: The [total fertility rate](#dod:fertility-rate) considers all births per woman. In contrast, the effective reproductive fertility rate considers only those expected to survive to their own childbearing years, and the effective labor fertility rate considers only those expected to survive to working age.

display.name: Effective fertility rate (children surviving until childbearing age)
Effective fertility rate (children surviving until working age)

sourceDesc: Malani and Jacob (2024); UN WPP (2024); HFD (2024)
